newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey issues new five-million lira banknotes.
newsitem.headline: Turkey issues new five-million lira banknotes.

text.p: Turkey's central bank began issuing new banknotes of five million liras ($46) on Monday in its ongoing struggle to keep up with runaway annual inflation of around 80 percent, state-run Anatolian news agency reported.
The new banknote is the second issue within two years. The central bank put the first one million lira-denominated notes into circulation in January 1995.
Over the weekend, Turkey's statistics office said December consumer price inflation rose slightly from a year ago to 79.8 percent annually.
Like all other Turkish paper money the new banknotes feature a portrait of Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, founder of the Turkish Republic.
The latest note is the ninth issue since 1981, when the 1,000 lira note was the largest denomination.
